org.jpws.pwslib.data

Class PwsRecordList

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecordList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PwsFile

    public class PwsRecordList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Top level structure of this library to represent a list of PWS records (PwsRecord). Each instance carries a unique identifier (UUID) which is supplied automatically (the value may get altered by subclasses). Note that this class is not synchronized. If multiple threads may modify a list instance structurally they MUST synchronize on the instance or equivalent other object.

    This class issues modification events which are defined by PwsFileEvent. All data of this list is kept in memory, hence the total amount of processable records might be restricted depending on the user's runtime environment.

    Above plain storage of records, and giving a set or records an identity, this class offers a) operations on the content set (like merge or group manipulation), b) buffered storage (returned objects are clones of the stored objects) and c) some semantical control (only valid records may be added or updated). Note: the semantical control is not complete as records are allowed to be invalid when they are read from a persistent state. Therefore it should not be assumed that all entries of a list of this class are valid records.

    See Also:
    PwsFile, PwsFileFactory, PwsFileListener, OrderedRecordList

      • addRecordValid

        public void addRecordValid(PwsRecord rec)
                    throws DuplicateEntryException
        Adds a clone of a semantically valid record to this list. The given record has to meet the following conditions for being added: a) returns true on its method "isValid()", b) may not already exist as an entry in this list (Record-ID (UUID) is used for identification). If one of these conditions is not met, the record will not be added and an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        rec - PwsRecord the record to be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the record is not valid
        DuplicateEntryException - if the record already exists
        Since:
        2-2-0

      • addRecord

        public void addRecord(PwsRecord rec)
               throws DuplicateEntryException
        Adds a record to this list. The condition for adding the record is that its identification (UUID) may not exist already in this list.
        Parameters:
        rec - the record to be added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the record has no Record-ID
        DuplicateEntryException - if the record already exists
        Since:
        2-2-0 modified validation logic

      • addRecordList

        public PwsRecordList addRecordList(PwsRecordList list)
                            throws DuplicateEntryException
        Adds a list of records into this record list. The first occurrence of a duplicate entry will break execution of the inclusion.
        Parameters:
        list - PwsRecordList
        Returns:
        a reference to this record list
        Throws:
        DuplicateEntryException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any input record is invalid
        Since:
        2-0-0, 2-1-0 enhanced

        public PwsRecordList cutSetRecordList(PwsRecordList list)
        Returns the cut set of this record list with the parameter record list. If the cut set is empty, an empty list is returned. (For identity only UUID of the records is evaluated; the elements of the result list are clones of elements of this list.)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        PwsRecordList cut set with parameter list

      • updateRecordList

        public PwsRecordList updateRecordList(PwsRecordList list)
        Updates a list of records in this record list. Unknown records of the parameter list are not updated and returned in the resulting record list. Does nothing if the parameter is null or the empty list.
        Parameters:
        list - PwsRecordList of records to be updated; may be null
        Returns:
        PwsRecordList subset of parameter list containing records which were not updated; null if empty
        Since:
        2-0-0

      • updateRecord

        public void updateRecord(PwsRecord rec)
                  throws NoSuchRecordException
        Updates an existing record in this list. The record to be updated is identified by its Record-ID (UUID). (Note that changes made to records obtained from this interface will not strike through to the corresponding list element. Hence the "updateRecord()" functions are the indicated way to effectively change an existing record in the list.)
        Parameters:
        rec - the record to be updated
        Throws:
        NoSuchRecordException - if the parameter record is unknown

      • updateRecordValid

        public void updateRecordValid(PwsRecord rec)
                       throws NoSuchRecordException
        Updates an existing valid record in this list. The record to be updated is identified by its Record-ID (UUID). If the record is not valid and exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        rec - the record to be updated; must be a valid record
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the record is not valid
        NoSuchRecordException - if the parameter record is unknown

      • getRecordCount

        public int getRecordCount()
        Returns the total number of records in this list.
        Returns:
        total number of records in the file

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator iterator()
        Returns an iterator over all records. Records may be deleted from this list by calling the remove() method on the iterator. This iterator returns records that are clone copies of the original file records; modified records have to get "updated" by use of the updateRecord() method. This iterator allows concurrent modifications of this list/database (it operates on a copy of the list structure created when the iterator is invoked).
        Returns:
        an Iterator over all records (with a snapshot of the list situation at the timepoint of invokation)

        Returns:

        Since:

      • getGrpRecordCount

        public int getGrpRecordCount(java.lang.String group,
                             boolean exact)
        Returns the number of records in the file which belong to the specified group value, including descendant groups. (Note that this function refers to the same set building principle as getGroupedRecords().)
        Parameters:
        group - String GROUP field selection value; may be null
        exact - whether elementary group names must match exactly the parameter
        Returns:
        number of specified grouped records in the file
        Since:
        0-4-0 (modified parameter list), 2-1-0 (modified parameter logic: group)

      • getGroupedRecords

        public java.util.Iterator getGroupedRecords(java.lang.String group,
                                            boolean exact)
        Returns an iterator over all records whose group value matches with the parameter value. Two modi operandi are possible: relaxed and exact. In exact mode the parameter value must be identical with an elementary group name in the record group value. In relaxed mode it suffices that the record value starts with the parameter value. Comparison is case sensitive.

        Example: Parameters "AA.Miriam.Car",true will return all records belonging to a group with this name, including all subgroups, but it will not return a record of the "AA.Miriam.Carfesh" group. In relaxed mode the records of the latter group are also returned.

        If group is the empty name, the returned iterator encompasses all records of this list. If group is null the iterator is empty.

        Records may be deleted from the file by calling the remove() method of the iterator.

        Parameters:
        group - String GROUP field selection value; may be null
        Returns:
        an Iterator of elements of type PwsRecord
        Since:
        0-4-0 (modified parameter list), 2-1-0 (modified parameter logic: group)

      • renameGroup

        public PwsRecordList renameGroup(java.lang.String group,
                                 java.lang.String newGroup)
        Renames the GROUP name of a set of records. The set of records is selected by the parameter group as if through getGroupedRecords(group,true). For each record of the group, the elementary group name part which is defined by group is replaced by the string newGroup.

        !!Note!! This is very powerful and you can relocate this group to a completely different place in the group tree!

        Parameters:
        group - String as a record group definiens
        newGroup - String that replaces the group text in the records' GROUP field
        Returns:
        PwsRecordList a list of the records actually modified by this operation
        Since:
        0-4-0, 2-1-0 return type (record list), event org

      • removeGroup

        public void removeGroup(java.lang.String group)
        Deletes a set of records which is defined by the group parameter. This affects all records which belong to the specified elementary group name.

        (The set of deleted records is equivalent to getGroupedRecords( group, true )).

        Parameters:
        group - String an elementary group name (of the record GROUP field)
        Since:
        0-4-0

      • getGroupList

        public java.util.List getGroupList()
        Returns an ordered list of the GROUP field values of this record list where each group name only shows once. (Ordering follows collation rules of the actual VM default locale.) The empty group name is considered a possible element. If this record-list is empty, an empty list is returned.
        Returns:
        java.util.List of strings
        Since:
        0-4-0

      • getGroupCount

        public int getGroupCount()
        Returns the number of distinct and used group names in the file. The empty group name is considered a possible element.
        Returns:
        int number of distinct groups
        Since:
        2-0-0

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        rec - the record to be deleted (may be null)

      • getBlockedDataSize

        public long getBlockedDataSize(int format,
                               java.lang.String charset)
        Returns the size of the data block required to store the content of this record list on a persistent state. (This takes into respect the general file formating rules of a PWS file of the specified format.)
        Parameters:
        format - the file format version of the persistent state
        charset - encoding used on text data of the contained records
        Returns:
        long required (blocked) data space
        Throws:
        java.nio.charset.IllegalCharsetNameException - if charset is unknown to the executing VM
        Since:
        2-0-0

      • getSignature

        public byte[] getSignature()
        Renders a content signature value for this list of records. Returns a SHA-256 checksum which is a sum-up of all its records' signatures. Note that this value is not strictly individual for a given instance because two lists with identical records (or empty) will have the same signature value. (It may be assumed - although there is no guarantee - that this value is identical over different releases of this software package and different sessions of a program running this package.)
        Returns:
        byte[] 32 byte signature value (SHA-256 digest)
        Since:
        2-0-0

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all records from this list / file.

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Returns a shallow clone of this record list (PwsRecordList). File-ID number is modified to be unique and any registered listeners are removed from the clone.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        object of type PwsRecordList
        Since:
        2-1-0

      • copy

        public java.lang.Object copy()
        Returns a deep clone of this record list (all records of the returned list are copies of the original). File-ID number is modified to be unique and any registered listeners are removed from the clone.
        Returns:
        object of type PwsRecordList
        Since:
        2-1-0

      • replaceFrom

        public void replaceFrom(PwsRecordList a)
        This method replaces entire content of this record list, including most settings, by the contents of the parameter record list. (This list keeps its original fileID number, thus making it different from the parameter list, but it takes over the other list's listUUID. The fileID, however, is only used for testing causes.) For any operational businesses, this list will have the identity of the parameter list and work as a shallow clone.
        Parameters:
        a - PwsRecordList new content and identity for this list

      • setModified

        protected void setModified()
        Sets the flag to indicate that the list of records has been modified. (There should not normally be any reason to call this method as it should be called indirectly when a record is added, changed or removed.)

      • resetModified

        public void resetModified()
        Resets the modified flag to false.

        Parameters:

        protected void fireFileEvent(int type,
                             PwsRecord rec)
        Fires a PwsFileEvent of the specified type to the listeners to this list.
        Parameters:

      • contentModified

        protected void contentModified()
        Sets this list to state MODIFIED and issues a CONTENT_CHANGED event to file listeners.
        Since:
        2-1-0

      • setEventPause

        public void setEventPause(boolean v)
        Switch to determine whether file-events shall be dispatched from this record list. (May be used to interrupt event handling during some operation phases.) This value is false by default.

        This method issues a LIST_UPDATED event when it switches from state true to state false.

        Parameters:
        v - true means events will be dispatched, false they will not be dispatched
        Since:
        2-0-0

      • getEventPause

        public boolean getEventPause()
        Whether this list object is set to not dispatch file events.
        Returns:
        true if and only if this list does not dispatch events
        Since:
        2-0-0

      • moveRecords

        public DefaultRecordWrapper[] moveRecords(DefaultRecordWrapper[] set,
                                          java.lang.String group,
                                          boolean keepPaths)
        Assigns a new GROUP value to any set of records within this record list, replacing previous assignments. Does nothing if the selection is empty. Note on return value: This method doesn't list records as moved whose group values would not change by the requested operation.
        Parameters:
        set - array of DefaultRecordWrapper, may be null
        group - a String value for the GROUP record field (may be null which is equivalent to empty)
        keepPaths - if true previously existing group values will be appended to the parameter group value
        Returns:
        DefaultRecordWrapper[] list of records actually moved or null if no operation
        Since:
        2-1-0

      • merge

        public PwsRecordList merge(PwsRecordList list,
                           int modus,
                           boolean allowInvalids)
        Merges the parameter record list into this list by optionally respecting various conflict handling policies (details see constants of this class). Records added by this method receive the transient property "IMPORTED" or "IMPORTED_CONFLICT", depending on how they were added. A returned record list informs the caller about record which have been excluded.
        Parameters:
        list - the list of records to be added
        modus - the merge conflict solving policy or 0; policy constants of this class may be combined by OR-ing them
        allowInvalids - determines whether invalid records of the source are excluded (=false) or considered candidates for inclusion (=true)
        Returns:
        a PwsRecordList holding all not included records from the parameter list
        Since:
        0-2-0

      • getUUID

        public UUID getUUID()
        Returns the UUID identifier of this record list.
        Returns:
        org.jpws.pwslib.global.UUID
        Since:
        2-0-0

      • setUUID

        public void setUUID(UUID fileUUID)
        Sets the UUID identifier for this record list.
        Parameters:
        fileUUID - org.jpws.pwslib.global.UUID (must not be null)
        Since:
        2-0-0
